label: 藤原通憲
本: The Pursuit of Loneliness: Chinese and Japanese Nature Poetry in Medieval Japan, ca. 1050-1150 . Franz Steiner Verlag Stuttgart . 1995
説明文: (1106-1159). Buddhist name Shinzei 信西. Political ally of Taira no Kiyomori and counsellor to Emperors Go-Shirakawa and Nijo he pressed for death penalties for the Minamoto involved in the Hogen Insurrection of 1156. He committed suicide when captured by the Minamoto on his flight to Nara during the Heiji Disturbance. Kanshi in Honchō mudaishi 本朝無題詩 (18). Catalogue of his library Tsuken nyudo zosho mokuroku. [平清盛、後白河、二条、源、保元の乱、漢詩、通憲入道蔵書目録]
